data.title: Good Old FOOD...Meat and Potatoes
data.text: The "afternoon" bartender is the best.  Not many stools, but if you get one you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Tasty food, fun atmosphere
data.text: We ate here for lunch, our first visit to the restaurant.  The walls are full of old Livermore history and fun to look at.  The food was tasty, the service good.  There was definitely a number of regulars eating there which is a good recommendation.  A little noisy but not unbearable. An enjoyable lunch with co workers, I'd eat there again.

data.title: Good Food
data.text: I have always had a good meal at the Riata. The only thing I would say about the atmosphere is it is very loud when crowded. Hard to have a conversation.

data.title: What Happened to the good old days
data.text: I went there for about a steady year before things started going south. There is a continuous change in employees and the place gets so busy they forget about you.

data.title: breakfast is good
data.text: the breakfast here is good- biskits and gravy, chicken fried steak.eggs benedict  BUT dinner is not so good- don't know why but I think the menu is too extensive and it complicates things. The service is great

data.title: Tuff prime rib
data.text:
Very loud restaurant, ordered prime rib meat very tuff hard to cut with knife lots of fat and grisle. And it did not look like prime rib.  Tasted  funny.  Prime rib should melt in you mouth and have a nice flavor. Mash potatoes  were so so.
When I mentioned this all they were concerned with is being paid. Need less to say I will not be back

data.title: Great breakfast place
data.text: I met a business associate for breakfast at The Riata for breakfast. It is a great local place. Everyone knew everyone in the place. Super friendly and great service. The two egg special is a great way to start the day. Hot, fresh and plenty of it, best describes the place. It is worth the stop.

data.title: Fun bar food
data.text: The Western decor speaks to Livermore's past. The atmosphere is fun and friendly. The food is bar comfort. Word of caution--the restaurant is quite loud so I wouldn't recommend it for a romantic dinner.

data.title: Yummy breakfast!!
data.text:
We have been meaning to go to The Riata for sunday breakfast and we finally did it today. The food was incredibly good and there was lots of it. I had the Veggie Eggs Benedict and they were so good - full of lightly sauteed veggies and country potatoes. Delicious! My husband had the Chicken Fried Steak and Eggs which he thoroughly enjoyed. We had lovely mimosas (made with Spanish cava) and my daughter had a full size "Eggs in a basket" which was def way too big for her but she enjoyed 1/2 of it :) 
The service was friendly and the atmosphere was good - lots of families. 
We will def come back.

data.title: Good Breakfast Spot
data.text: We love going here for breakfast. The omelettes are great, the specials are great and they make the best bloody Mary's in town.  It gets crowded in the late mornings on the weekends. It is a wonderful spot for a midday breakfast with a customer or family member

data.title: Good food and great western flair
data.text: The food at this place is pretty good.  The portions are relatively large and the prices are very reasonable.  The service is attentive and friendly.  Best of all, the western themed decoration gives the place a very nice old school feel.

data.title: Western Flair in Downtown Livermore
data.text: Decent beer selection, mixed drinks, reasonable prices.  Food is good, not great but you are not paying a ton.  Very "old school" type bar and diner

data.title: What Livermore was, is still alive
data.text: When you enter and see all the cowboy memorabilia and hats on the wall you know you're in cattle country. That atmosphere alone, makes it worth the trip. And the food is hearty and well prepared, whether breakfast, lunch or dinner. A great change of pace from the other fine eateries in Livermore, and compliments the area wonderfully. If you have a hankerin' to see where Livermore came from to get to this vibrant town, this is a good start. Family friendly, & the bar pours good drinks too.

data.title: Great Breakfast
data.text: Haven't been for dinner but best breakfast place in Livermore.  They have a full bar open at breakfast.  Can get quite busy on the weekends.

data.title: Really good food in a fun atmosphere.
data.text: The Riata appeals to me for 3 reasons. Maybe it is because of my Texas background but I love the ambiance with the rodeo cowboy hats and photos, the comfort food and the reasonable prices. Real fried chicken and steaks. Have a huge country breakfast on sundays. Delicious big portions.

data.title: Good food, booze and service!
data.text:
Been here three times now on the weekends.  Although we haven't had the kids, have seen a number of families in the outdoor patio . They seemed accommodating. 
I was apprehensive re some of the reviews buy been very pleased. Great booze and service.

data.title: Not a Family Enviroment -
data.text:
The menu has a good cross selection of dishes, nothing too expensive.  Quality of the food is middle of the road, with good portion sizes.  And it is at this point that the review goes into the tank.  Two different visits, over a 3 month period and the same problems presented itself.  

The Riata Diner has a full service bar across one end of the dining area.  Noise and conversations from the bar roll across the entire dining area.  If the discussion at the bar is R or X rated, everyone will hear it, which is exactly what occurred the last two times my family and kids were in the establishment.   In both cases, it was the same people at the bar behaving badly….

First visit, we tolerated the potty mouth conversation from the woman at the bar, and spoke with the bartender about the concern when we were leaving Second visit, the same woman was in full battle dress ensuring  use of MF this and that in what seemed to be every statement.  I spoke with the on duty manager, and was advised the place is a tavern, the bar would be located in the dining area and to expect some rough language.  

That being the case, then I contend, this is not a family venue that I would recommend to anyone.  I do know from my bartending training and experience, this sort of event could have been easily defused by the bartender on duty refusing to serve any more drinks to the people behaving badly.

Low ratings are because of both experiences and I cannot recommend this establishment at all.

data.title: Full of Drunks
data.text:
I ate here once a week for 18 months straight, but the service became extremely poor and the food quality slid to new lows.

I just had dinner here tonight. This is the first time in over a year and the good news is that service has gotten much better. The bad news is that the food is still just OK and the noise level is unbearable. The bar area was crowded with a group of drunks that were out of control. Management should have cut them off and asked them to leave, but that did not happen because they were obviously Requlars and the bartenders were drinking with them. 

I will not be back and I DO NOT recommend if you have small children. The drunks tend to cuss loudly.

data.title: Remnds Me of Home!
data.text: Born and raised in farm and ranching country....this always feels like family when we go to the Riata. Fantastic food and lots of it!

data.title: Throwback decor but perfect diner food
data.text: What a fun place! Breakfast served any day until 2pm. Great sandwiches! Have a beer while someone is having eggs and bacon.  Their version of a French dip is so yummy that plates are licked clean. Service is excellent, like mom is taking care of you! Can't wait to go back.
